headerText: The `v-tabs` component is used for hiding content behind a selectable item. This can also be used as a pseudo-navigation for a page, where the tabs are links and the tab-items are the content.

fixedTabs.desc: The **fixed-tabs** prop sets a higher minimum width and applies a new maximum width to `v-tabs-items`. On desktop screens, the tab items will be centered within the `v-tabs` component and switch to evenly fill on mobile.

right.desc: The **right** prop aligns the tabs to the right

content.desc: Tabs are not the only thing you can put inside the `v-tabs` component. In this example we've also added a toolbar.

search.desc: Here is another example of additional content inside the `v-tabs` component.

iconsAndText.desc: By using the **icons-and-text** prop you can add icons to each tab item.

alignWithTitle.desc: Make `v-tabs` lined up with the `v-toolbar-title` component (`v-toolbar-side-icon` or `v-btn` must be used in `v-toolbar`). May not work if the tab text is wrapped.

grow.desc: The **grow** prop will make the tab items take up all available space.

overflowToMenu.desc: You can use a menu to hold additional tabs, swapping them out on the fly

pagination.desc: If the tab items overflow their container, pagination controls will appear.

icons.desc: **prev-icon** and **next-icon** can be used for applying custom pagination icons.

props.alignWithTitle: Make `v-tabs` lined up with the toolbar title
props.cycle: Will reset to first or last tab when swiping left or right if at the end of indexes
props.grow: Force `v-tab-item`'s to take up all available space
props.iconsAndText: Will stack icon and text vertically
props.sliderColor: Changes the background color of an auto-generated `v-tabs-slider`
